revised_title: The Role of Coelomic Fluid and Amoeboid Cells in Earthworm's Protective Mechanism
tldr: The author investigates the functions of the coelomic fluid and amoeboid cells in the earthworm, discovering their role in a protective mechanism. The coelomic fluid contains various microorganisms and amoeboid cells that help the earthworm defend itself against parasites and pathogens. The cells exhibit amoeboid movements and can form plasmodia to combat these threats.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cellular Biology
